intro: Chlamysporum anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marsh grass, is a perennial herb native to wetland habitats in North America. It features slender, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 2 millimeters wide, arranged in dense tufts. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, which are often submerged or partially submerged in water. Its rhizomes form dense colonies, helping to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in marsh environments. Chlamysporum anceps plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
